abstract: Google changed nothing about how it handles the data it collects when it introduced its new flu-tracking service.
snippet: Google changed nothing about how it handles the data it collects when it introduced its new flu-tracking service.
lead_paragraph: When Google released its Flu Trends service earlier this week, the Drudge Report flashed a headline that read: “SICK SURVEILLANCE: GOOGLE REPORTS FLU SEARCHES, LOCATIONS TO FEDS.”

headline.main: Is There a Privacy Risk in Google Flu Trends?

abstract: Users of the voice technology can ask any question, ranging from “Where’s the nearest Starbucks?” to “How tall is Mount Everest?”
snippet: Users of the voice technology can ask any question, ranging from “Where’s the nearest Starbucks?” to “How tall is Mount Everest?”
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Pushing ahead in the decades-long effort to get computers to understand human speech, Google researchers have added sophisticated voice recognition technology to the company’s search software for the Apple iPhone.

headline.main: Google Is Taking Questions (Spoken, via iPhone)
headline.print_headline: Google Is Taking Your Questions (Spoken, via the iPhone)
